etymologies: late 17th century: from Hebridean Norn dialect, from Old Norse fúll ‘stinking, foul’ (because of its habit of regurgitating its stomach contents when disturbed) + már ‘gull’

definitions: a gull-sized gray and white seabird of the petrel family, with a stocky body and tubular nostrils.

notes.text: Genus Fulmarus, family Procellariidae: two species, in particular the northern fulmar (F. glacialis) of the arctic

shortDefinitions: gull-sized grey and white seabird of petrel family
